docs.lead_paragraph: DR. HAROLD S. KOPLEWICZ is chief of child and adolescent psychiatry at Schneider Children's Hospital and Hillside Hospital at the Long Island Jewish Medical Center. After graduating from the Albert Einstein College of Medicine, Dr. Koplewicz completed a pediatric internship at the Bronx Municipal Hospital Center. He studied general psychiatry at Cornell University and completed a two-year research fellowship through the National Institute of Mental Health. Dr. Koplewicz is a clinical psychopharmacologist. He follows the approach of prescribing medications like Ritalin and Prozac to treat behavioral, anxiety and other disorders. His book "It's Nobody's Fault" (Times Books) advises on diagnosing and treating 13 mental disorders of childhood and adolescence.
